title: (x) Numbers for letters - various {gang}
content:
I realize one can do this manually, but what are some typefaces that use number characters in place of letters?   
   
i.e. "SE7EN" or "CH33SE"

 [‹ Archive through July 02, 2003](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821164254/http:/www.typophile.com/node/517 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Fighting for a place in the team - Eagle Bold {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821164254/http:/www.typophile.com/node/495 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Eric Gordon

comments.content:
[FF Letter Gothic Slang](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821164254/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=FF011072X1P2&start=1) replaces about every character   
with another one, and some of them are numerals.

_\> I realize one can do this manually_   
   
One _SHOULD_ do this manually IMHO. ;)

Kemie, Yves   
   
Thanks for your input. I also thought of TPC

Orav might work. You can get it in the custommade section at this site: [http://www.signalgrau.com/eyesaw/html/main.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821164254/http:/www.signalgrau.com/eyesaw/html/main.htm)  
   
It is also the font used in their navigation bar, so you can see what it looks like. It is free too!
